db:abstract.db:para: The QSqlIndex class provides functions to manipulate and describe database indexes.

db:listitem.db:para: QSqlIndex is part of Database Classes

db:section.db:title: Detailed Description
db:section.db:para: An index refers to a single table or view in a database. Information about the fields that comprise the index can be used to generate SQL statements.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.8] cursorName : QString
db:section.db:para: This property holds the name of the cursor which the index is associated with.
This property was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [since 6.8] name : QString
db:section.db:para: This property holds the name of the index.
This property was introduced in Qt 6.8.

db:section.db:title: [explicit] QSqlIndex::QSqlIndex(const QString &cursorname = QString(), const QString &name = QString())
db:section.db:para: Constructs an empty index using the cursor name cursorname and index name name.

db:section.db:title: QSqlIndex::QSqlIndex(const QSqlIndex &other)
db:section.db:para: Constructs a copy of other.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.6] QSqlIndex::QSqlIndex(QSqlIndex &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-constructs a new QSqlIndex from other.

db:note.db:para: The moved-from object other is placed in a partially-formed state, in which the only valid operations are destruction and assignment of a new value.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept] QSqlIndex::~QSqlIndex()
db:section.db:para: Destroys the object and frees any allocated resources.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlIndex::append(const QSqlField &field)
db:section.db:para: Appends the field field to the list of indexed fields. The field is appended with an ascending sort order.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlIndex::append(const QSqlField &field, bool desc)
db:section.db:para: This is an overloaded function.
Appends the field field to the list of indexed fields. The field is appended with an ascending sort order, unless desc is true.

db:section.db:title: QString QSqlIndex::cursorName() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the cursorName.

db:section.db:title: bool QSqlIndex::isDescending(int i) const
db:section.db:para: Returns true if field i in the index is sorted in descending order; otherwise returns false.

db:section.db:title: QString QSqlIndex::name() const
db:section.db:para: Returns the name.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlIndex::setCursorName(const QString &cursorName)
db:section.db:para: Sets cursorName to cursorName.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlIndex::setDescending(int i, bool desc)
db:section.db:para: If desc is true, field i is sorted in descending order. Otherwise, field i is sorted in ascending order (the default). If the field does not exist, nothing happens.

db:section.db:title: void QSqlIndex::setName(const QString &name)
db:section.db:para: Sets name to name.

db:section.db:title: [noexcept, since 6.6] QSqlIndex &QSqlIndex::operator=(QSqlIndex &&other)
db:section.db:para: Move-assigns other to this QSqlIndex instance.

db:note.db:para: The moved-from object other is placed in a partially-formed state, in which the only valid operations are destruction and assignment of a new value.

db:section.db:para: This function was introduced in Qt 6.6.

db:section.db:title: QSqlIndex &QSqlIndex::operator=(const QSqlIndex &other)
db:section.db:para: Sets the index equal to other.
